espnscrapeR 0.2.0
  • Reference

Scrape NFL stats from nfl.com at the team level.

Source: R/scrape_team_stats_nfl.R
scrape_team_stats_nfl.Rd

Please note that the column names are identical between offense/defense and you should reference the 'role' column for offensive or defensive stats.

scrape_team_stats_nfl(
  season = 2019,
  stats = "GAME_STATS",
  role = "offense",
  season_type = "Regular"
)

Arguments

season

character or numeric - greater than 1970
stats

character - either "GAME_STATS", "SCORING", "TEAM_PASSING", "TEAM_RUSHING", "TEAM_RECEIVING", or "OFFENSIVE_LINE"
role

character - "offense" or "defense"
season_type

character - either 'Regular' or 'Playoffs'

Value

tibble

Examples


# Get the NFL.com game-level stats for offense in 2018
scrape_team_stats_nfl(season = 2018, stats = "GAME_STATS", role = "offense")
#> Scraping GAME_STATS for offense from 2018 Regular!
#> Error in open.connection(x, "rb"): HTTP error 404.

# Get the NFL.com team-level passing stats for defense in 2014
scrape_team_stats_nfl(season = "2014", stats = "TEAM_PASSING", role = "defense")
#> Scraping TEAM_PASSING for defense from 2014 Regular!
#> Error in open.connection(x, "rb"): HTTP error 404.
